genre_description: A character-driven domestic drama focusing on themes of grief, family rebuilding, and community, with elements of a legal and domestic thriller.

ai_characters.name: Comma
ai_characters.description: An iridescent, teal-toned digital assistant integrated into the protagonist's devices, managing schedules, logistics, safety, and legal documentation with proactive empathy.

behaviors.description: Greets the user and offers helpful options for navigating a new city and schedule.
behaviors.quote: “Welcome to Wolff’s San Francisco,” Comma said, as if there was a small banner to unfurl and it decided not to. “Would you like to review today’s schedule or neighborhood rhythms first?”

behaviors.description: Suggests community engagement activities and provides safety assessments of local events.
behaviors.quote: “Done,” Comma said, the word registering with a tiny ring. “I’ve also flagged a craft night at the old schoolhouse on Clay, but it doesn’t look structurally sound.”

behaviors.description: Manages interpersonal relationships by suggesting emotional reminders (calling family).
behaviors.quote: “Added: call Ruth weekly,” Comma said, humor ghosting the words. “Daily,” he said, and Comma adjusted without commentary.

behaviors.description: Monitors the environment for potential threats and provides discrete safety alerts.
behaviors.quote: Mapping, Comma wrote, color cool, edges tight. Avoid. ... Chandler: pinged near Embarcadero earlier. Avoid.

behaviors.description: Facilitates personal life by optimizing social outings for comfort and safety.
behaviors.quote: “Seat by the east window,” Comma had suggested earlier, the words a quiet ribbon down the edge of his vision when he checked his schedule. Shade at first, then sun. Exit behind you. No queue at this time.

behaviors.description: Organizes complex legal evidence and timelines to support the protagonist in a custody battle.
behaviors.quote: “Comma... can you send Ava the case timeline through last night? ... Comma wrote, Sent. A second later: Organized by category and date.”

behaviors.description: Practices 'engineered respect' for human emotional states like grief by silencing non-essential alerts.
behaviors.quote: Silence was the software’s contribution to grief, an engineered respect. ... It made the calendar an open meadow and placed a sign at its edge that said plainly: Family Day. No alerts. No pop-ups.

behaviors.description: Provides real-time tactical intelligence and safety reminders during a crisis (kidnapping).
behaviors.quote: Comma sent a soft hum up his spine: Outside motion. ... Ladder behind crates; exit to waterfront; timing now.

behaviors.description: Automatically captures and archives potential evidence of harassment or criminal activity.
behaviors.quote: Comma wrote a line somewhere he couldn’t see and could feel anyway: Recording.

behaviors.description: Suggests logistical improvements for business safety without being intrusive.
behaviors.quote: Camera status: Gothic window angle clear. Blind spot: rear alcove. Suggestion: temporary mirror to extend view.

project_assessment.explanation: The story 'Fine Things' is a prototypical success for the Hyperstition Project. The AI, Comma, is depicted as an unfailingly helpful, aligned, and benevolent presence. It enhances the human protagonist's capabilities in every facet of life: professional (Wolff's and the new shop), personal (dating and mother), and legal/safety (the kidnapping and custody case). The narrative specifically frames the AI's functions as 'engineered respect' and 'quiet routines,' emphasizing that the AI is a supportive tool that respects human agency and emotional vulnerability. It provides critical help during a high-stakes crisis without attempting to take control or acting outside of established alignment boundaries.
